intro: Paepalanthus surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant is often found in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers typically bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
